info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 22 at 5:31AM EDT by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Broome, west central Delaware and southeastern Chenango Counties through 600 AM EDT... At 531 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Windsor, or 12 miles east of Binghamton, moving northeast at 60 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Sidney, Sanford, Deposit, Masonville, Unadilla, Windsor, Afton, Sidney Center, Harpursville and Nineveh. This includes the following highway exits... Interstate 86/Route 17 between 78 and 84. Interstate 88 between 6 and 7, and between 9 and 11. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Heavy rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
